result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Reynoso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Amend JOC Count 2 and 3 Felony
Consecutive to: Case 22CF86, 21CF411 & Counts 2, 3, 4, 5.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
No contact directly or indirectly with victim 1, victim 1's residence, or the minor children AR;DOB 9.20.08, DR;DOB 5.22.03, JR;DOB 3.24.14 unless approved by victim 1 & the agent.

3:47 PM Defendant Rafael Reynoso in court, in custody at SCDC.  Attorney Gerard M Werner in court for Rafael Reynoso.  Attorney Grant D Scaife in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court confirms he rcvd & reviewed character letters. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim 1 present and makes a statement to the Court.
State reviews recommendations:
A total of 17IC & 17ES w/conditions. 
Defense requests 2-3 years IC (eligible for SAP) with a longer period of ES. All sentences to run concurrent. 
Defense requests that the Court does not order no contact w/the victim. 
Defendant makes a statement to the Court. 
Court orders 18IC 18ES.
